Key Match Events: Milwaukee broke open the game in the eighth inning by scoring four runs off Reed Garrett, the first runs he allowed since Aug. 18.
The Brewers are 17 of 17 in stolen-base attempts against the Mets after swiping two more Saturday.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets and Braves have head-to-head tiebreaker advantages over the Diamondbacks.
The Mets and Braves would play a Monday doubleheader in Atlanta if their postseason fates haven’t been settled.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets first baseman Pete Alonso said, “It’s a really short runway, but we do have three games, and three games are opportunities for us.”
Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said, “Not winning the past couple of days is putting us in a difficult situation here.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The NL Central champion Brewers improved to 12-1 in their last 13 meetings with the Mets, including 5-0 this season.
Quintana and four relievers combined to strike out 18 — their most in a nine-inning game since a 20 against Pittsburgh on Sept. 18, 2022.
Others: Joey Ortiz drove in three runs for Milwaukee and the New York Mets mustered just two hits as their playoff hopes sustained another blow with a 6-0 loss to the Brewers on Saturday night.
